text: R version provides similar functionality R-native syntax: examples detailed documentation, see README.Rmd.
code: # Load the package library(flightanalysis) # Or source files directly: # source('R/flight.R') # source('R/scrape.R')  # One-way trip scrape <- Scrape("JFK", "IST", "2026-07-20") print(scrape)  # Round-trip scrape <- Scrape("JFK", "IST", "2026-07-20", "2026-08-20")  # Chain-trip scrape <- Scrape("JFK", "IST", "2026-08-20", "RDU", "LGA", "2026-12-25")  # Perfect-chain scrape <- Scrape("JFK", "2026-09-20", "IST", "2026-09-25", "CDG", "2026-10-10", "JFK")  # Create Flight objects flight1 <- Flight("2026-07-20", "JFKIST", "9:00AM", "5:00PM",                    "8 hr 0 min", "Nonstop", "150 kg CO2", "10% emissions", "$450") flight2 <- Flight("2026-07-21", "ISTCDG", "10:00AM", "2:00PM",                    "4 hr 0 min", "Nonstop", "100 kg CO2", "5% emissions", "$300") flight3 <- Flight("2026-07-22", "CDGJFK", "11:00AM", "1:00PM",                    "8 hr 0 min", "1 stop", "200 kg CO2", "15% emissions", "$500")  # Convert flights to data frame df <- flights_to_dataframe(list(flight1, flight2, flight3))  # Scrape live data (requires chromote package) install.packages(c("chromote", "progress")) scrape <- ScrapeObjects(scrape)  # Must capture return value! Uses Chrome directly - no drivers! print(scrape$data)
